title: Joey Barton responds to claims he dived and scratched a Lincoln player in the face during FA Cup shock
text:
Sport Joey Barton responds to claims he dived and scratched a Lincoln player in the face during FA Cup shock An old tweet about diving also came back to haunt the Burnley midfielder as he faced a torrent of abuse online for his antics Share Joey Barton went down holding his face (Photo: Getty Images Europe)   
Oh Joey Barton . 
Yet again the Burnley midfielder is the centre of controversy after an event-filled FA Cup clash against Lincoln. 
Barton was trolled on Twitter after clashing with the Imps' Matt Rhead; appearing to intentionally walk into the striker's arm before falling to the floor clutching his face. 
Soon after he was spotted clawing Terry Hawkridge across the face but escaped a red card, being handed just a yellow. 
And after the game - which the non-league side won thanks to a late Sean Raggett goal to make FA Cup history - Barton took to Twitter to answer his critics. 
"Wasn't trying to get the Big Man sent off. It was my job to front screen and disrupt him. Was trying to get back in front of him," he said, referring to the Rhead incident. 
"Tried to duck under his arm and he moved it back and hit me on the head. Contact is part of the game, no problem with that." Burnley's Joey Barton clashes with Lincoln's Alex Woodyard (Photo: REUTERS) 
He went on to claim Hawkridge was not scratched in the face, despite replays suggesting he very much was. 
Barton added: "Unlike their player saying he was kicked on the floor and also the one who jumped and held his face as if he'd been struck. 
"But that wouldn't make a good story would it. Fair play to Lincoln. They where well organised and that's Cup football. Good luck in next round." 
No-body online was buying Barton's explanations while an old tweet the controversial midfielder sent was dragged up to embarrass him even more. 
In 2013 the then QPR man tweeted: "Players who roll around when nobody touches them should be subsequently banned. I hate cheats. Authorities should address it." poll loading Should Joey Barton have been sent off? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
